result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Kameron C Montgomery in court, in custody.  Attorney Frank Remington for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD has not yet found an attorney for this case. Court reschedules. Court finds good cause to set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m. except only for purposes of employment. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

04:17 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
